title: Fix Subject-to-Career AR Explorer module accessibility

requirements.text: Create a new page component at frontend/src/pages/SubjectToCareer.tsx that displays the Subject-to-Career AR Explorer module content with a header, description explaining how subjects connect to career paths, and placeholder content indicating AR features are coming soon

quotes: Subject to career AR module not accessible

acceptanceCriteria: New SubjectToCareer.tsx file exists in frontend/src/pages directory
Component includes a header with 'Subject-to-Career AR Explorer' title
Page displays an informative description about exploring career paths through subject connections
Component follows the same responsive design patterns as other pages (mobile-first, gradient backgrounds, card-based layout)
Page is accessible when navigating from the Modules page

requirements.text: Add a new route for '/subject-to-career' in frontend/src/App.tsx that renders the SubjectToCareer page component, ensuring it follows the same routing pattern as existing module routes like '/career-path', '/stream-selector', and '/chatbot'

quotes: Subject to career AR module not accessible

acceptanceCriteria: Route '/subject-to-career' is registered in the router configuration in App.tsx
Route successfully renders the SubjectToCareer component
Navigation to /subject-to-career from any page works correctly
Browser back/forward buttons work correctly with this route

requirements.text: Update frontend/src/pages/Modules.tsx to ensure the 'Subject-to-Career AR Explorer' module card has the correct path='/subject-to-career' in its ModuleCard component, matching the pattern used by other module cards

quotes: Subject to career AR module not accessible

acceptanceCriteria: The Subject-to-Career AR Explorer card in Modules.tsx includes path='/subject-to-career' prop
Clicking the 'Explore' button on the Subject-to-Career AR Explorer card navigates to /subject-to-career
The module card displays with the same styling and interaction pattern as other module cards
No console errors occur when clicking the module card

constraints: Do not modify frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts or frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts
Follow existing component patterns from CareerPath.tsx, StreamSelector.tsx, and other module pages
Maintain responsive design consistency with mobile (<768px), tablet (768px-1024px), and laptop (>1024px) breakpoints
Use Tailwind CSS classes consistent with the existing design system
nonGoals: Implementing actual AR functionality or 3D features
Adding backend data storage for AR module interactions
Creating complex interactive visualizations beyond basic UI
Integrating third-party AR libraries or frameworks
